item.title: Python - Multiprocessing
item.description:
Sources used: [1] Red Hat Developer - How to use a Python multiprocessing module [2] Process vs Thread: What’s the difference? [3] Python Multiprocessing Example

YouTube sources: [4] Python Multiprocessing Tutorial: Run Code in Parallel Using the Multiprocessing Module [5] Python Threading Tutorial

Learn [[Python - Threading]] Here!

Multiprocessing is a Python package that supports spawning processes using an API similar to the threading module [1].

In general, a process is the execution of a program whereas a thread is the execution unit part of a process [2]. Whereas a thread is lightweight, a process is heavyweight - processes do not share data and memory with one another while threads do.
